Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did the Immigration Officer act reasonably in denying the humanitarian and compassionate grounds application?
Crimes.Application_Facts: Applicant claimed close ties with her co-tenant and child in Canada
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Permanent residence on humanitarian and compassionate grounds
Crimes.Defendant_Behavior: Remained in Canada beyond authorized stay
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Humanitarian and compassionate grounds based on family ties
Crimes.Assessment_Factor: Degree of hardship to applicant and family if removed
Crimes.Applicable_Legislation: Subsection 25(1) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Evidence_Used: Affidavits, relationship details, duration of stay
Crimes.Evidence_Assessed: Nature and depth of familial relationships in Canada
Crimes.Relief_Sought: Discretionary exemption from removal and permanent residence
Crimes.Governing_Rule: Subsection 25(1) allows discretion for H&C exemptions
Crimes.Harm_Assessment: Officer found insufficient hardship to justify exemption
Crimes.Cause_Description: Applicant overstayed visa and sought permanent residence due to personal ties in Canada
Crimes.Evidence_Handling: Officer considered but did not find compelling evidence of hardship
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Violated: Section 25(1) compliance not met for exemption
Crimes.Evidence_Issues: Lack of sufficient documentation or proof of exceptional circumstances
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Issue: Federal Court jurisdiction over immigration decisions
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Relationship claims acknowledged but not deemed sufficient
Crimes.Decision_Rationale: No exceptional circumstances demonstrated to warrant relief
Crimes.Decision_Making_Body: Immigration Officer, Department of Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada

Crimes.Crime_Name: Failure to comply with Immigration and Refugee Protection Act requirements
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of Officer’s assessment of H&C grounds
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Relationship claims not found sufficient to establish hardship
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Close relationship with co-tenant and children in Canada
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to meet threshold for H&C exemption
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None indicated – evidence considered but not persuasive
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether decision was within range of reasonable outcomes
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: Process found to be procedurally fair
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not directly challenged, but weight given to evidence was limited
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Application for judicial review based on unreasonableness
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Compliance with procedural fairness in decision-making
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to meet statutory requirements for exemption
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Overstay and failure to qualify for H&C relief
